intro: Quercus tauricola, commonly known as the Crimean oak, is a species of flowering plant in the beech family Fagaceae. It is native to the Crimean Peninsula and parts of southern Ukraine, where it thrives in temperate climates. The tree is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves and produces acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and has a rounded crown. The bark is thick and fissured, providing structural support and protection against environmental stressors.
